library(earthquakeDC)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(readr)

This vignette has a brief overview of the earthquakeDC R package created to visualize NOAA earthquake data. It cleans data and visualizes them using ggplot2 and leaflet packages.

Package functions
There are four exported functions available to users:

eq_clean_data()
eq_map()
eq_create_label()
geom_timeline()


eq_clean_data(df)
The first function is required to clean data for the visualization. It creates a DATE column in Date format, transforms latitude and longitude to numeric format and trims country from LOCATION_NAME.

filename <- system.file("inst/data/signif.txt", package = "earthquakeDC")
df <- readr::read_delim(filename, delim = "\t")


The rest three functions uses ggplot2 package to display earthquakes' timeline. 

geom_timeline()
This function geom requires clean data created from the eq_clean_data function . The required aesthetics is x with dates,  y axis is optionalfor grouping by country, and size and color that can be applied by users.

eq_map()
This package uses leaflet functions to show earthquakes on a map using eq_map() function. 

eq_create_label()
Lable can be created with this function.
